page.title: 02Brick making in Fletton - 1.
page.content: On Wednesday, all the girls in our class got in the minibus to go the the local London Brick Company (L.B.C.) works. Our local works is called Beeby's and there are quite a few brickyards in our region. When we arrived we were met by Mr. Harviss and Mr. Furr who then gave us a guided tour. The first thing that we saw was the long snake-like conveyor belt which carried enormous lumps of clay all the way to the works from the quarry, where, in the distance we could see the excavator, or 'navvy', with its huge jaws eating into the freshly revealed deposits of clay. Then we wre taken to the building where the clay was first of all crushed. After this crushing by huge metal rollers, it travelled by conveyor belt to the separator.
